content.description:
Wolverine is steep and still slightly dirty as of July 2019. More traffic should remedy that problem. The crux is past the 3rd bolt. This route could be easier if you go left at the 3rd bolt.

It shares an anchor with route to the left,

Salomon Super Stick

.
content.protection: Quickdraws for 4 bolts and an anchor with Mussy hooks.
content.location:
This route is on the far left end, just past the black streak. It is the second route from the end of the wall, right of

Salomon Super Stick

and left of Memorial Day Crack.

content.description:
Start under and right of

Put Up

(5.9+) clipping 4 bolts to a shared anchor with

Shut Up

(5.9).
content.protection:
Quickdraws for 4 bolts and a 2 Mussy hook anchor shared with

Shut Up

(5.9).
content.location:
It is 1 bolted route left of

Put Up

.

content.description:
Climb up and clip a high first bolt, then go up challenging moves to a

shared anchor with

Throw Up

(5.9).
content.protection:
Quickdraws for 4 bolts and a shared anchor (with

Throw Up

(5.9)) with 2 Mussy hooks.
content.location:
It is 1 bolted route left of

Throw Up

.

content.description:
This is steep with boulder moves for first 2 bolts. It is still dirty. With more traffic, that should be better.

It shares an anchor with the right route,

Wolverine

.
content.protection: Quickdraws for 3 bolts with Mussy hooks.
content.location:
Saloman Super Stick is the last route on the wall, just left of

Wolverine

. There is one more route slightly detached back and left called Short but Sweet with 3 bolts.

content.description: This route is steep and overhanging for the first 2 bolts, but good stems make it not too hard. It is interrupted by a ledge between the 2nd and 3rd bolts.
content.protection: Quickdraws for 3 bolts and a 2 Mussy hook anchor.
content.location: It is a bolted route on the right side after passing Grow Up (5.6).

content.description: A pleasant bouldery start climbs quickly to a crux near the 3rd bolt on a smooth section with small fingers and reaches. Pulling up to a thin ledge below the roof, a second crux at the 4th-5th bolt overhang, will let you use all of your big words between breaths, though a pretty good underpull finger crack will help you yell those words louder to your appreciative belayer. Lots of chalk dots lessens the mystery.
content.protection: 5 bolts lead to double anchors with quicklinks and 2 Mussy hooks.
content.location:
Just one stride to the left of the start of

Match It

â€” go on the left side of the boulder to the first ledge, and keep aiming straight up. Note: this route can be toproped after leading

Match It

by making a 10-foot PG-13 traverse to the left of the anchor to the anchors of Rumney.

content.description: Climb a hard section at the 3rd bolt. Then there is another hard section at 5th bolt, big step up onto left hand sidepull. This is the best route on the lower wall.
content.protection: Quickdraws for 6 bolts and an anchor with 2 Mussy hooks.
content.location:
It is 1 bolted route left of

Batch It

(5.9-).

content.description: Like many routes at Hurd Creek, the first bolt is probably too low to protect, but the second bolt is easy to reach and at better height. Slopers and thin fingers greet the fourth and fifth bolts with a slight overhang. Unlike the route's name, it is now a pretty clean climb with some crunchy lichen in non-critical cracks. This is a good, fun challenge that feels at grade.
content.protection:
4 bolts lead to double anchors with safety latches and quicklinks.

Per

Kevin Gillest

: as of 9/13/11: the route now has 5 bolts with 2 Mussy hook anchors.
content.location:
The second bolted line left of

Match It

(

Rumney

is in between). The route can be found up the path to the right that leads around the wall; about 15 feet as the horsefly flies. On the route, move up and right; don't confuse bolts with

Bird's Nest

nearby.

content.description: This is a very nice route that's really cleaned up since it was documented in Shaw and Shaw (2nd). The crux is well-protected toward the top of the climb (small roof) by closely spaced bolts. Be wary of animal feces at the upper bolts.
content.protection: 4 (7?) bolts with double anchors at the top (quicklinks and Mussy hooks). There are supposed to be 6 bolts, but it would seem that the first two places to bolt belong to Choss Pile Right, which makes for suboptimal rope management.
content.location:
It is just left of

Choss Pile Right

, which is just up the ramp right of

Match It

and the others on the first, main section of Lower Wall. The start is very close to

Choss Pile Right

, so aim straight up and left-ish, aiming for the notched rock at the very top.

content.description: Climb a bouldery, hard start before the ledge after the 2nd bolt. The upper moves seem to all move up and left.
content.protection: Quickdraws for 2 bolts and an anchor with 2 Mussy hooks.
content.location:
It is 1 bolted route left of

Shut Up

.
